repo.description: Python client and plugin host for Nvim
repo.name: pynvim

body: Nvim oldtest for if_pyth cover some cases not covered by test suite of pynvim. Instead of porting them to pynvim, we can just clone neovim repo to run those oldtest

comment_data.body: probably only need to run against one python version.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -96,3 +95,36 @@ jobs:
         which -a python3
         python3 --version
         tox run
+
+  oldtest:
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false
+      matrix:
+        config: *test-matrix
+        exclude:
+          - config: { neovim-version: 'stable'} # skip stable neovim for oldtest, to avoid duplicate runs

comment_data.body:
presumably we also want to run `test/functional/provider/python3_spec.lua` ? and if so, that would be 1 extra line:

    make functionaltest TEST_FILE=test/functional/provider/python3_spec.lua

doesnt block this PR, but i'm just thinking that we should name this `testupstream` or something, instead of `oldtest` ?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -96,3 +96,56 @@ jobs:
         which -a python3
         python3 --version
         tox run
+
+  oldtest:

comment_data.body: if we do `make` in this step (or a separate step), then the `make oldtest` step below will be much less noisy, which is a nice QoL improvement.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -96,3 +96,58 @@ jobs:
         which -a python3
         python3 --version
         tox run
+
+  oldtest:
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false
+      matrix:
+        config:
+          - python-version: '3.12'
+        os: ['ubuntu', 'macos', 'windows']
+
+    name:
+      oldtest (python ${{ matrix.config.python-version }},
+            ${{ matrix.os }}-${{ matrix.config[matrix.os] || 'latest' }})
+    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}-${{ matrix.config[matrix.os] || 'latest' }}
+
+    steps:
+    - uses: actions/checkout@v3
+    - uses: actions/setup-python@v4
+      with:
+        cache: 'pip'
+        python-version: ${{ matrix.config.python-version }}
+
+    - name: install pynvim
+      run: |
+        ./scripts/disable_log_statements.sh # Make pynvim in release-ready state
+        python3 -m pip install -e .
+
+    - name: clone neovim
+      run: |
+        git clone --depth=1 https://github.com/neovim/neovim.git neovim-repo

@@ -96,3 +96,58 @@ jobs:
         which -a python3
         python3 --version
         tox run
+
+  oldtest:

comment_data.body:
"oldtest" still showing in CI

```suggestion
      test-upstream (python ${{ matrix.config.python-version }},
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -96,3 +96,60 @@ jobs:
         which -a python3
         python3 --version
         tox run
+
+  test-upstream:
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false
+      matrix:
+        config:
+          - python-version: '3.12'
+        os: ['ubuntu', 'macos', 'windows']
+
+    name:
+      oldtest (python ${{ matrix.config.python-version }},

comment_regular_data.body:
Currently oldtest fail with the following error
```
Found errors in Test_python3_pyeval():
Caught exception in Test_python3_pyeval(): Vim(return):E5108: Lua: Vim:error caught while processing request 'python_eval ['vim']': Traceback (most recent call last):stack traceback:   [C]: at 0x5c4857697c46 @ command line..script /media/brianhuster/D/Projects/neovim/test/old/testdir/runtest.vim[657]..function RunTheTest[61]..Test_python3_pyeval[42]..provider#python3#Call, line 1
```
The test fail is
```vim
  let caught_859 = 0
  try
    let v = py3eval("vim")
  catch /can not serialize 'LegacyVim' object/
    let caught_859 = 1
  endtry
  call assert_equal(1, caught_859)
```
For pynvim installed with `uv tool install pynvim --reinstall`, if I run `:let v = pyeval("vim")`, it returns error `can not serialize 'LegacyVim' object` as the test expects. But if checkout to latest 0.6.0 release (`git checkout 466ffc8cc0caacca91c434d0adb61dfba73ccd7e`) and install from source with `uv tool install . --reinstall`, then run `:let v = pyeval("vim")` then the error is just 
```
E5108: Lua: Vim:error caught while processing request 'python_eval ['vim']': Traceback (most recent call last):
stack traceback:
	[C]: at 0x58fda7d70460
```
No idea why it cannot show pynvim error now

LegacyVim is stored in `sys.modules` here: https://github.com/neovim/pynvim/blob/9f7df02b7c117c1026bb776678796f56f8069625/pynvim/plugin/script_host.py#L35-L36

perhaps the `VimPathFinder.find_module` which was removed in https://github.com/neovim/pynvim/commit/9f7df02b7c117c1026bb776678796f56f8069625 was helping with serialization? Try reverting that commit here?

I tried checking out even farther, to the commit when 0.6.0 was released

```
brianhuster@brianhuster-ThinkPad-E14-Gen-4:/media/brianhuster/D/Projects/pynvim$ git checkout 4357c2b01953bc28fc3f33f5cc6cf52c6626574f
Note: switching to '4357c2b01953bc28fc3f33f5cc6cf52c6626574f'.

You are in 'detached HEAD' state. You can look around, make experimental
changes and commit them, and you can discard any commits you make in this
state without impacting any branches by switching back to a branch.

If you want to create a new branch to retain commits you create, you may
do so (now or later) by using -c with the switch command. Example:

  git switch -c <new-branch-name>

Or undo this operation with:

  git switch -

Turn off this advice by setting config variable advice.detachedHead to false
```

So it is weird because if I install from uv registry, it works. But if I checkout to the same release (0.6.0) and install from current directory, it doesn't

> if I install from uv registry, it works. But if I checkout to the same release (0.6.0) and install from current directory, it doesn't

We do some pre-processing for releases, e.g. we remove debug logging: https://github.com/neovim/pynvim/blob/9f7df02b7c117c1026bb776678796f56f8069625/scripts/disable_log_statements.sh#L6-L8
Oh yes, that is the reason. If I run `./scripts/disable_log_statements.sh` before installing from source, then tests will pass
Btw, how should I run oldtest on Windows?
Ready for review. Only a few MacOS tests (that have always been flaky) fail

repo.description: Python client and plugin host for Nvim
repo.name: pynvim

title: ci: also run upstream Nvim if_pyth tests
